Jim Dixon wrote:

>> with java you have to let the hotspot warm up, running the code
>> several times to let the jvm analyze code.
> 
>> Run the benchmark for some seconds, than start to measure.
> 
> Like hell you do.
> 
> When you are benchmarking one thing against another, you
> don't give one preferential treatment.  You run them under exactly
> the same conditions. 

Well, then give C++ time to "warm up", too... ;)

Seriously, it depends on why you are benchmarking. When you are
interested in speed of long running, server side software, start-up and
warm-up time are quite uninteresting...

Take care, Ilja
